values.text: According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, as there are other individuals sharing the same house with you. You are required to be transferred to a designated facility for isolation. Testing for COVID-19 is not required however, if you choose to do the test kindly note that as per government directive, the cost of the test will be covered by you. You can book an appointment at one of UAE's testing/screening centers and make sure to bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19, kindly self-isolate for 14 days AND DO the questionnaire again if patient develops symptoms. 
Testing for COVID-19 is not required however, if you choose to do the test, kindly note that as per government directive, the cost of the test will be covered by you. You can book an appointment at one of UAE's testing/screening centers and make sure to bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

values.text: I don't have number of cases in this location
$webhook_result_3.result
People who have the flu will typically experience symptoms within 14 days. The symptoms for COVID-19 can develop between 114 days.

However, according to 2020 research, the median incubation period for COVID-19 is 5 days. As a point of comparison, the incubation period for a cold is 13 days. For more info check out this link https://bit.ly/2XlB2k6 and check the symptoms difference in this image.

You can only take your car if it's an emergency. It's advised to stay home. In case you have an emergency, a maximum number of three persons is allowed inside cars. For more information check this link: https://bit.ly/2JODSWD

generic.title: Here are some of the most up-to-date bulletins from the CDC:

options.label: Watch this video to learn about COVID-19
Facts About COVID-19 from the CDC
Latest summary update from the CDC

values.text: Drive Through testings cost around 370 AED, price might be slightly changed depending on the provider. Regular tests in Health Centers cost 112 AED.

Main guidelines to know about groceries:
-Make sure to ware gloves and mask, if not you will have to pay a fine.
-Grocery shops cannot exceed 30% of customers capacity.
-When returning home, it's better to keep your shoes out of your house, change the gloves and as for masks, if you have the cheap ones then throw them, if you have the better quality, then make sure to wash it and put it under the sun so it can dry out.
For more tips about Do's and Don'ts, check this link: https://bit.ly/2wsgprm
Yes, but order food that is cooked well and make sure to eat it while its hot.
Go to this web site for the latest update on the COVID-19 situation from the CDC:  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/cases-updates/summary.html
Read more about it:  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/share-facts.html
Know the facts about coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and help stop the spread of rumors.
Read more about it:  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/share-facts.html
If you are going for a screening or to a testing center, make sure to bring your Emirates ID and your Insurance card.

1- Call DHA Helpline on this number 800 342 to schedule an appointment.
2- Make sure to bring along your Emirates ID and Medical Insurance Card.
3- Head to the assigned hospital for your test:
	 3.1 Register with payment of 112 AED. 
	 3.2 You will get an initial assessment (Blood pressure, temperature, etc).
	 3.3 You will fill a self declaration form (Travel history, etc) 
	 3.4 Swab test (as medically prescribed). 
	 3.5 Get your results within 24 hours.

Only people working in vital fields, including energy, communications, medical, police, army, pharmaceutical, electricity and water, airport and immigration, banking, mass media and construction sectors, as well in petrol stations, will be allowed to leave home for now. Check this link for more information https://bit.ly/2xd00Yb .

If you have taken the test and the result is positive, a team member of the test center will contact your for the required procedure. You can always check with your test center as the laboratories are working 24/7 to ensure accurate results at the earliest time.

In case of an emergency, you can call the following numbers while anywhere in the UAE:

911 for Police
998 for Ambulance
997 for Fire Department (Civil Defence)
996 for Coastguard
991 for electricity failure
922 for water failure.

Call for help, information and services related to the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) through the following channels:

Ministry of Health & Prevention at 800-11111 
Estijaba service at the operation center Department of Health  Abu Dhabi at 800-1717 
Dubai Health Authority at 800-342.
All pets are safe, they have no chance to pass and infect you with the corona virus. Please do not abandon your pets. Check this link for more info: https://bit.ly/3aVpsjr
Here is important information for travelers from the CDC: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/index.html

All schools, colleges and universities are closed until a further notice. To make sure education is still going all class sessions have been moved online. For more info check this link https://bit.ly/39Tuuvx

- Always make sure to wear masks and gloves when you leave your house
- Practice social distancing by keeping at least 6 feet (about two arm lengths) away from others
-Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds
-Stay home if you can and avoid any non-essential travel.
For more information about safety guidelines please check this link: https://rdcrss.org/2VfaqOK
For information on how to properly remove masks check this link: https://bit.ly/2xZeD1c
Watch this video from the World Health Organization to learn what we know about COVID-19 right now: https://youtu.be/mOV1aBVYKGA

Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) is a new strain of coronavirus, first identified in a cluster with pneumonia symptoms in Wuhan city,   Hubei province of China. Most of the cases were epidemiologically linked to the seafood and animal market. It started on 31st of December 2019, but unfortunately no one knows when it will end. Older adults and people of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions (Asthma, HIV, Cancer, Diabetes) might be at higher risk for severe illness from COVID-19. For more info, check this link: https://bit.ly/2XloMQo

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19 since you are symptomatic. Kindly make sure to check the nearest AHS clinic and bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk COVID-19 since you are symptomatic with shortness of breath. Kindly make sure go to the nearest Emergency Center and bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).

values.text: Public buses are available for free, and taxis are giving 50$ discount. For more information visit the link: https://bit.ly/3aQ74IG

Dubai Metro and Tram services will be suspended from April 5 until further notice. Public buses are available for free, and taxis are giving 50$ discount. For more information visit the link: https://bit.ly/3aQ74IG

generic.title: Do you have family members living with you in the same house?

values.text: According to assessment, it appears that you may be at risk for COVID-19, as there are other individuals sharing the same house with you. You are required to be transferred to a designated facility for isolation. Testing for COVID-19 is not required however, if you choose to do the test kindly note that as per government directive, the cost of the test will be covered by you.  You can book an appointment at one of UAE's testing/screening centers and make sure to bring along your documents (Emirates ID and Medical Insurance card).
For now, Festival City in Dubai just opened its first screening drive through center. More are coming soon.  You can check more about it here: https://bit.ly/2yJPIPI

Check DHA Primary Health Centers here: https://www.bayut.com/mybayut/corona-virus-test-dubai/

For locations of hospitals check the map here: https://bit.ly/2XfZJyh

Have you been in contact with someone known to  have coronavirus?

values.text: According to a statement issued by the Abu Dhabi Media Office, the national sterilisation programme in the Capital will be from 8pm to 6am in residential areas, and 6pm to 6am in industrial zones and workers accommodations. For more information check this link: https://bit.ly/2JOq7rd
The National Sterilisation Programme in Dubai will be extended to 24 hours a day across all areas and communities for a period of two weeks subject to renewal.
Individuals are not allowed to leave the house, except for essential purposes or if they are working in vital sectors exempted from the restrictions.

If you wish to leave your home, make sure to submit a request here move.gov.ae. All people leaving home should wear a mask, gloves and ensure they keep a safe distance from others. Check more about it here https://bit.ly/2xXtBoi.
Check Abu Dhabi's Health Care Centers here: https://bit.ly/3b4EzHD<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/embed?mid=12XytpJ6bESmXl8SLMAAC1cvnCpjxUsR0" width="640" height="480"></iframe>
For now, SEHA has drive through screening centers in Abu Dhabi, and more are opening soon. You can check more about it here: https://bit.ly/2xXzv94

All shops are closed. Only supermarkets and pharmacies are open 24/7. Vet clinics and service providers (laundries, banks, food providers, etc...)as well are open. For more details check this link https://bit.ly/2JNTjhK.
